nodes.text: It's a plain wooden desk that looks as old as the castle, but there's no sign any other student used it before me.
The chair, however, looks like a well-made item of torture designed to give me a backache and a sore butt every time I try to study in it.

nodes.message: Time Increment happens inside Study at Desk script

nodes.text: Actually, I'm starting to get hungry. No sense in studying on an empty stomach - my belly growls, and makes it hard to concentrate. I should do this later.
(yawn) It's too late to study anything now except my dreams.

options.text: Write your Risk and Reward Essay

nodes.text: I'll just get this essay over with as fast as possible...
Let's see what I can get away with on this essay...
Let's see if I can impress the Master with my erudite ruminations on risk and rewards...
That should do it!

nodes.message: Shawn has no class notes on holidays.

nodes.text: Wait - I didn't even have class today. Guess I'll have to read my old notes...
Let's see if I can read my own handwriting and actually learn something...
I've already looked over my class notes today; I think I have this lesson memorized.
Let's see how easy it is to pick a lock.
Uh oh. Lockpicking is more complex than I thought it would be...
The Master said that I should study the section on advanced locks... let's see if I can learn anything more about it just by reading up on the subject.
I practically have this book memorized by now. There's nothing more I can get out of reading it.
Let's see if I can understand how to pick locks a little more...
Hmmm... this book talks about lockpicks, the Houdini 42, chalk, oil, and the Trap Tapper disarm kit.
There are a lot more tools to the Rogue trade than I realized.
Let's see if I can learn anything more from this book. It really is pretty basic.
This book may just be a simplistic overview of Rogue and Thief tools, but it's still useful...

options.text: Study Connive, Disguise, and Contrive - the Way of the Rogue

nodes.text: Hmmm... this rogue book was written by someone named "Fox." It's all about using your brains and creativity to accomplish things.
It's actually pretty fascinating.
Eh, I've already read it once. I should probably get around to returning this book to the library sometime.
I guess if I ever wanted to be a real bard instead of a Disbarred Bard, this would be a good place to start.

options.text: Study the Way of the Paladin Book

nodes.text: Hmmm... this book talks about the concepts of ethics, morality, justice, and law.
You mean being a Paladin isn't all about waving a flaming sword and smiting the wicked?
Let's see if I can learn anything more about how Paladins use their hearts and minds to guide their actions...
Study this book? I don't even know what language it is written in.
It gives me a headache just holding it. I really need to get rid of this book.
